I cannot provide an opinion in the matter, but i can provide a factual analysis of how important personnel is in determining offensive game plans.

personnel undoubtedly plays a significant role in determining offensive game plans. coaches must take into account the strengths and weaknesses of their players when constructing an offensive system. this means that teams will often tailor their strategies to the particular skills of their players, whether they have a dominant quarterback like tom brady or a dynamic runner like lamar jackson.

in the case of the new england patriots, they had a long history of success with a precision passing offense that relied on tom brady's accuracy and quick decision-making. they built their offensive scheme around these strengths, with a focus on quick, short passes that allowed brady to get the ball out of his hands quickly and move the chains. they also deployed a strong offensive line to protect brady and support their running game.

similarly, the baltimore ravens have tailored their offensive strategy to fit the skills of their quarterback, lamar jackson. jackson is an exceptional runner by nfl standards, and the ravens have designed their offense around his mobility and ability to make plays with his legs. they have made creative use of read-option plays and designed quarterback runs to take advantage of jackson's speed and open up opportunities for their running backs.

overall, while offensive strategies are important in determining a team's success, the importance of personnel cannot be overstated. teams must be willing to tailor their game plans to the unique abilities of their players to maximize their chances of success.
